TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates organic geometry. Access commands to create T-Spline bodies.
Creates a T-Spline box.
Select a plane and draw a rectangle. Use the manipulators or input fields to specify the height and number of faces.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a plane and draw a rectangle. Use the manipulators or input fields to specify the height and number of faces.

Description._LCLZText: Direction changes how the box is built releative to your original input rectangle. Mirror allows you to maintain symmetry in subsequent modeling edits

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a T-Spline plane.
Select a plane and draw a rectangle. Use the manipulators or input fields to specify the height and number of faces.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a plane and draw a rectangle. Use the manipulators or input fields to specify the number of faces.

Description._LCLZText: Mirror allows you to maintain symmetry in subsequent modeling edits

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a T-Spline cylinder.
Select a plane and draw a circle. Use the manipulators or input fields to specify the height and number of faces.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a plane and draw a circle. Use the manipulators or input fields to specify the height and number of faces.

Description._LCLZText: Direction changes how the cylinder is built releative to your original input circle. Mirror allows you to maintain symmetry in subsequent modeling edits

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a T-Spline sphere.
Select a plane then a center point for the sphere. Use the manipulators or input fields to specify the diameter and number of faces.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a plane then a center point for the sphere. Use the manipulators or input fields to specify the diameter and number of faces.

Description._LCLZText: Reducing the number of faces below 8 or 4 in either directioin, the body will no longer be spherical. Mirror allows you to maintain symmetry in subsequent modeling edits.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a T-Spline torus.
Select a plane and draw a circle. Use the manipulators or input fields to specify major and minor diameters and the number of faces.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a plane and draw a circle. Use the manipulators or input fields to specify major and minor diameters and the number of faces.

Description._LCLZText: Reducing the number of faces below 8 in either directioin, the body will no longer be round. Mirror allows you to maintain symmetry in subsequent modeling edits.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a T-Spline quadball.
Select a plane then a center point for the sphere. Use the manipulators or input fields to specify the diameter and number of faces.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a plane then a center point for the sphere. Use the manipulators or input fields to specify the diameter and number of faces.

Description._LCLZText: The Quadball is approximately a sphere with no polar points. Mirror allows you to maintain symmetry in subsequent modeling edits.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Manages the creation of complex topologies base on selected curves. Paths can be sketch geometry and edges of bodies.
Select the input path, specify the global diameter then modify sections, paths, and the number of faces.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the input path, specify the global diameter then modify sections, paths, and the number of faces.

Description._LCLZText: In Sections, click points on the path to make local diameter changes. In End Types, select open ends to change their shape. In Segments, define the number of faces between pipe sections.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates individual T-Spline faces.
Select a plane to begin defining vertices or select vertices from a T-Spline body.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a plane or existing vertex to begin. Continue setting points to define the face.

Description._LCLZText: Pick existing vertices to connect the face to that geometry. Enable Object Snap to position new vertices on the closest solid, surface, or mesh body.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates or modifies a T-Spline body by adding faces along a vector.
Select sketch curves, profiles or faces. Use the manipulators or input fields to specify the distance and number of faces.

Tips._LCLZText: Select sketch curves, profiles or faces. Use the manipulators or input fields to specify the distance and number of faces.

Description._LCLZText: Set the Spacing setting to Curvature to add faces in areas of higher curvature.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a T-Spline body by revolving edges or sketch geometry around a selected axis.
Select sketch curves, profiles, planar faces, or edges then select the axis to revolve around. Use the manipulators or input fields to specify the number of faces.

Tips._LCLZText: Select sketch curves, profiles, planar faces, or edges then select the axis to revolve around. Use the manipulators or input fields to specify the number of faces.

Description._LCLZText: Set the Spacing setting to Curvature to add faces in areas of higher curvature. Circular Symmetry allows you to maintain symmetry in subsequent modeling edits

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a T-Spline body by sweeping edges or sketch curves along a selected path.
Select sketch curves or profiles then select the path to sweep along. Use the manipulators or input fields to specify percentage length of the path and the number of faces.

Tips._LCLZText: Select sketch curves or profiles then select the path to sweep along. Use the manipulators or input fields to specify percentage length of the path and the number of faces.

Description._LCLZText: Set Curvature in the Spacing setting to add faces in areas of higher curvature. Changing the Orientation will affect the topology of your geometry.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Manipulates faces, edges and vertices with transform, scale and rotate editing.
Select faces, edges, or vertices to enable the manipulator. Double click a face or edge to select a loop.

Tips._LCLZText: Select faces, edges, or vertices to enable the manipulator. Double click a face or edge to select a loop.

Description._LCLZText: Hold the Alt key and drag a manipulator to insert new geometry based on the action.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Inserts edges at a specified position from the original edge.
Select an edge or double click to select a loop.

Tips._LCLZText: Select an edge or double click to select a loop then spedify the position of the new edge.

Description._LCLZText: Set the Insertion Mode to Exact to insert the edge without changing the shape of the T-Spline, however this will add more faces to maintain the shape.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Moves the selected edge along the control polygon.
Select the edges then specify the new position.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the edges then specify the new position.

Description._LCLZText: Slide the selected edge closer to another to make the transition between the two sharper.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Replaces a single edge with a specified number of adjacent edges.
Select the edges then specify the position of the bevel.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the edges then specify the position of the bevel.

Description._LCLZText: The closer you make the bevel the sharper the corner will appear. The segment settings adds more edges to the beveled region.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Inserts an edge by selecting two points.
Select a point on an edge to start. Continue selecting points on additional edges to divide multiple faces.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a point on an edge to start. Continue selecting points on additional edges to divide multiple faces.

Description._LCLZText: Slide the pointer along the edge until a red dot is shown, this is the midpoint of the edge. Set the Insertion Mode to Exact to insert the point without changing the shape of the T-Spline body, however this will add more faces to maintain the shape.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Aligns the first set of selected edges to a second set of selected edges.
Select the first set of edges then the second set of edges.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the first set of edges then the second set of edges.

Description._LCLZText: Use Merge Edge in place of Weld Vertices when connecting multiple vertices along the selected edges.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Divides one or more faces into a subset of faces.
Select the faces to divide. Hold Ctrl (Windows) or Command (Mac) to select multiple faces.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the faces to divide. Hold Ctrl (Windows) or Command (Mac) to select multiple faces.

Description._LCLZText: Enable the Specify option and set the number of faces that are added.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Joins two or more vertices.
Select two vertices to join. Window select vertices to weld within the specified tolerance.

Tips._LCLZText: Select two vertices to join. Window select vertices to weld within the specified tolerance.

Description._LCLZText: Use the Weld Mode to weld the first vertex to the second or weld both selections to the midpoint.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Disconnects an edge or loop.
Select an edge or double click to select a loop. Hold Ctrl (Windows) or Command (Mac) to select multiple edges.

Tips._LCLZText: Select an edge or double click to select a loop. Hold Ctrl (Windows) or Command (Mac) to select multiple edges.

Description._LCLZText: A darker line indicates that the edge has been unwelded and is no longer connected.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a sharp edge between faces.
Select edges to crease.

Tips._LCLZText: Select edges to crease.

Description._LCLZText: Regions around star/cap points (highlighted yellow) will cause edge creases to end abruptly. Boundary corner vertices (indicated by yellow dots at the surface boundary) can also be creased and uncreased.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Restores previously creased edges to their original state.
Select creased edges to uncrease.

Tips._LCLZText: Select edges to uncrease.

Description._LCLZText: Regions around star/cap points (highlighted yellow) will cause edge creases to end abruptly. Boundary corner vertices (indicated by yellow dots at the surface boundary) can also be creased and uncreased.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Projects vertices to a best fit or user defined plane.
Select the vertices and/or tangency handles to flatten.

Tips._LCLZText: Select vertices and set whether you are moving control points or surface points.

Description._LCLZText: The minimum number of vertices per surface for Flatten operation depends on Direction type: 4 for Fit, 1 for Plane, and 2 for Parallel Plane. If you flatten linked tangency handles, they will get unlinked from their vertices. The more vertices in the region the better the flatten result will look. Use the Subdivide command to add more geometry for better flattening.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Straightens vertices to a best fit or user defined line.
Select the vertices and/or tangency handles to straighten.

Tips._LCLZText: Select vertices and set whether you are moving control points or surface points.

Description._LCLZText: The minimum number of vertices per surface for Straighten operation depends on Direction type: 3 for Fit, 1 for Line, and 2 for Parallel Line. If you straighten linked tangency handles, they will get unlinked from their vertices.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Smoothes an area of the T-Spline geometry.
Select the faces to smooth and the smoothing rate.

Tips._LCLZText: Select around the desired area and play with the smoothing rate for desired result. Change the smoothing rate to see results in real-time.

Description._LCLZText: Select the faces and set smoothing rate.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Snaps selected T-Spline vertices to a face or surface. The vertices could be control points or surface points.
Select the vertices to move and the vertices will automatically move to the nearest body.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the vertices to move and the vertices will automatically move to the nearest body.

Description._LCLZText: Change the Target Select to specify targets. Set the Pull Type to move surface points or control points.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Switches the location of the surface and the control points to improve fitting. Select whether to move the control points to the surface or the surface to the control points.
Select the body then set whether you are moving control points or surface points.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the body then set whether you are moving control points or surface points.

Description._LCLZText: Interpolate is best used in conjunction with the Control Frame Display mode (Ctrl + 2).

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates segments to connect two opposing faces within a body or between two bodies.
Select the first set of edges then select the second set of edges.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the first set of edges then select the second set of edges. The number of edges on each side must be equal to or a multiple of each other.

Description._LCLZText: You can specify the number of faces between the edges. The Follow Curve option will use a sketch curve to influence the shape of the bridged faces.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a body offset.
Select the body then set the thickness and end treatments.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the body then set the thickness and end treatments.

Description._LCLZText: Thicken tool does not check for self intersections during creating and can create surfaces that will not convert to a solid.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Fills an internal hole in T-Spline body.
Select the edge of the hole and set the fill type.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the edge of the hole and set the fill type.

Description._LCLZText: Fill Star will fill using a single face. Reduced Star will fill with mulitple faces to minimize star points. Collapse brings all vertices together at a single vertex.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Deletes a part of connected T-Spline geometry and fills new gaps with faces. You can use this to remove struts or bridges.
Select the faces to erase and select fill type.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the faces to erase and set the fill type.

Description._LCLZText: Fill Star will fill using a single face. Reduced Star will fill with mulitple faces to minimize star points.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Aligns the edges of a T-Spline body with the edges of a surface or solid or with sketch curves.
Select the edges to modify then select the target edges or sketch curves.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the edges to modify then select the target edges or sketch curves.

Description._LCLZText: Use the Spacing and Tolerance options to control the faces and deviation from the target edges.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Changes the body type of the selected object. Converts BRep (solid or surface) faces to a T-Spline face. Converts a T-Spline body to a BRep body. Converts a quad mesh to a T-Spline body.
Select the object to convert.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the object to convert.

Description._LCLZText: BRep faces, T-Spline bodies or Mesh bodies can be filtered for selection. The options available depends on the filter selected.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Removes pinching near star points. Changes non-uniform faces to uniform.
Select the body to regularize.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the body to regularize.

Description._LCLZText: This command may change the shape of the T-Spline body if there are areas that are non-uniform.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Analyzes the T-Spline body and displays information about the mesh. Corrects Error T and Error Star conditions.
Select the body to analyze.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the body to analyze. This command can be used to evaluate a body without repairing or making any changes.

Description._LCLZText: Clicking on a Star will convert it to a T-Junction and vise versa. Use Autorepair to let the software try to repair the model.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Sets the body display to smooth, box, or control frame. Smooth shows the actual model. Box displays only the control framework. Control frame displays the framework and the actual model.
Select the desired display mode. If there is more than one T-Spline body, you need to select the body to change the display.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the desired display mode. If there is more than one T-Spline body, you need to select the body to change the display.

Description._LCLZText: Toggle between modes by holding Ctrl (Windows) or Control (Mac) and the 1, 2, or 3 key. This function is also available in the Edit Form dialog box in Selection Options.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Toggles between better performance or better display. Better display shows the bodies at highest quality (G1 conditions at star points). Better performance calculates modification by applying G0 conditions at star points.
Creates a mirror symmetry with the elements of a T-Spline body.
Select a face on each side of the body. If needed select edges on each side, then vertices.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a face on each side of the body. If needed select edges on each side, then vertices.

Description._LCLZText: Symmetry lines are displayed in green.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates circular symmetry with the elements of a T-Spline body.
Select a face on the body then select the number of symmetry lines.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a face on the body then select the number of symmetry lines.

Description._LCLZText: The possible areas of symmetry are calculated automatically based on the selected face and the body.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Create a duplicate body mirrored across a specified plane.
Select the body to copy then select the mirror plane.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the body to copy then select the mirror plane.

Description._LCLZText: The weld option will join the bodies where they intersect within the specified tolerance.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Create specified number of duplicate bodies around a selected axis.
Select the body to copy then select the axis to revolve around.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the body to copy then select the axis to revolve around.

Description._LCLZText: The weld option will join the bodies where they intersect within the specified tolerance.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Remove symmetry constraint from individual bodies or a series of bodies.
Select the symmetric bodies.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the symmetric bodies.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Prevents symmetric transformations from being applied to the selected vertex, edge or face.
Select the faces, edges, or vertices to remove symmetry from.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the faces, edges, or vertices to remove symmetry from.

Description._LCLZText: The non-symmetric faces are displayed in red.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Freezes faces and edges on the model to prevent accidental changes.
Select faces or edges to freeze.

Tips._LCLZText: Select faces or edges to freeze them.

Description._LCLZText: Light blue edges represent user-frozen regions. Darker blue edges show the buffer regions that are automatically locked to prevent shape changes in the user-frozen regions.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Unfreezes faces and edges that have previously been frozen.
Select faces or edges to unfreeze.

Tips._LCLZText: Select frozen faces or edges to unfreeze them.

Description._LCLZText: Light blue edges represent user-frozen regions. Darker blue edges show the buffer regions that are automatically locked to prevent shape changes in the user-frozen regions.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Inserts a T-Spline (TSM) file as T-Spline bodies.
